svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: The following procedure is presented for reference purposes only. The instructions provided with the maintenance kit should always be used in lieu of those presented here.

caution.para: The AR 1 may be lightly clamped in a bench vise during dis assembly, however, over clamping will cause damage to the valve and result in leakage and/or malfunction. If a vise is to be used, position the valve so that the jaws bear on the supply ports on opposing sides of the valve's body.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 6 for all item numbers in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove all air fittings and plugs from the valve

Mark the relationship of the antilock electronic controller and valve cover to the body (Item 18, Figure 6 ). Note the position of the mounting bracket and mark the relationship of the bracket to the valve body, cover, and antilock controller. Remove and retain the four capscrews and lock- washers (Item 1) that secure the controller to the cover (Item 7), then carefully remove the electronic controller without damaging its gasket (Item 3).
While holding the exhaust cover (Item 24), remove and discard the retaining ring (Item 25) that secures it to the body (Item 18).
Remove and discard the exhaust cover (Item 24) along with both o-rings (Items 22 and 23).
Remove and discard the valve spring (Item 22), valve retainer (Item 21) and the valve assembly (Item 20) from the body (Item 18).

Remove and retain the two capscrews (Item 5) and lockwashers (Item 6) that secure the cover (Item 7) to the body (Item 18). Remove and retain the two bolts (Item 4), lockwashers (Item 6), and nuts (Item 10) that secure the cover (Item 7) and mounting bracket to the valve body (Item 18).

Separate the cover (Item 7) and mounting bracket from the body (Item 18), then remove and discard the sealing ring (Item 14). Remove and retain the two capscrews and lockwashers (Item 8) that secure the bracket to the cover (Item 7).
Remove and retain the relay piston (Item 16) and relay piston spring (Item 17) from the body (Item 18).

note.para: The relay piston spring (Item 17) is not used in all valves.

step1.para: Remove and discard the o-ring (Item 15) from the relay piston (Item 16).
Remove and retain the service port cap nut (Item 11) from the cover (Item 7), then separate and discard the cap nut o-ring (Item 12) from the cap nut.
Remove and discard the quick exhaust diaphragm (Item 13) from the cover (Item 7).
Remove the quick exhaust diaphragm retaining screw (Item 26), the diaphragm washer (Item 27) and the diaphragm (Item 28) from the cover (Item 7).
